documentation.text:
@dev Contract module which allows children to implement an emergency stop
 mechanism that can be triggered by an authorized account.
 This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the
 modifiers `whenNotPaused` and `whenPaused`, which can be applied to
 the functions of your contract. Note that they will not be pausable by
 simply including this module, only once the modifiers are put in place.

@dev The pausable constructor sets the original `pauser` of the contract to the sender
 account & Initializes the contract in unpaused state..
@return true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Only pauser is allowed to perform this operation"

arguments.value: Only pauser is allowed to perform this operation

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Only pauser is allowed to perform this operation"

documentation.text: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the pauser.

@dev Allows the current pauser to transfer control of the contract to a newPauser.
 @param newPauser The address to transfer pauserShip to.

@dev Transfers control of the contract to a newPauser.
 @param newPauser The address to transfer ownership to.

devdoc.details: Contract module which allows children to implement an emergency stop mechanism that can be triggered by an authorized account. This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifiers `whenNotPaused` and `whenPaused`, which can be applied to the functions of your contract. Note that they will not be pausable by simply including this module, only once the modifiers are put in place.

changePauser(address).details: Allows the current pauser to transfer control of the contract to a newPauser.

params.newPauser: The address to transfer pauserShip to.

returns._0: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.
